conclusion: Problem involves an ideal gas undergoing a cyclic process returning to initial state A.
p-V diagram shows cyclic process for an ideal gas with isothermal and adiabatic processes.
Process A→B is isothermal at 200 K, work formula involves volumes V_A and V_B.
Process B→C is adiabatic, work formula involves pressures and volumes.
Process C→A is adiabatic and reverses B→C, work cancels out.
Total work done by gas is zero as the gas returns to initial state.
